DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Blood Isolate Species Identification Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time when the diagnostic blood isolate species was identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease)._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms._Collected; brought together in one place._Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The result of an action._The procedure of having an identity established._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._A specific individual microbe and its genetically identical progeny separated on a single occasion from a sample taken from a host or culture system._A group of organisms that differ from all other groups of organisms and that are capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:A specific individual microbe and its genetically identical progeny separated on a single occasion from a sample taken from a host or culture system.:A group of organisms that differ from all other groups of organisms and that are capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.:The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
A specific individual microbe and its genetically identical progeny separated on a single occasion from a sample taken from a host or culture system.
A group of organisms that differ from all other groups of organisms and that are capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
